There's a CSS rule to remove bottom padding on the messagebox if the next message is from the same person, do we want to preserve that? (That's why there's 0 bottom padding on the above screenshot)

image.png
I think in the design stroke is included in top 5px space... so 4px and then 1px stroke and after 2px space
I guess bolder font and other font sizing things make it a bit harder to evaluate
About the special spacing, I guess we can discuss that in the context of typography. That is why I suggested to deal with it first.

I thought I would like this change, but I'm not too keen on it in this deploy. Maybe I'm just used to it being more visible.
I suppose the idea is for it to be much less (barely!) visible, so if so then it satisfies that criterion.

I definitely like the concept of having the unread marker be more separated from the focus rectangle. but given that some actions rely on clearly knowing which message is highlighted, I wonder if this has gone too far the other way, ie. it's less easy to discern at a glance.
I like this new rectangle quite alot, but I want it to be higher contrast. (so, darker in light mode, lighter in dark mode, I guess)
it also currently clashes with the thicker side border on the messages, so if that were also thinned out...

great, let me review that better than I did last time :wink:
I've been noticing the increased spacing between messages too... Evy, does the updated PR make sure that the spacing is the same as it currently is?

I've also been noticing that this change creates more lines (by removing the overlap between the blue rectangle and other lines), which is especially noticeable for me at the end of message blocks. But I think that will feel different once we implement the grey background.

Screen-Shot-2022-12-02-at-11.02.40-AM.png

I'm using the dark theme. (Probably everyone should mention this since the experience is different!).

Personally I think I like that it's visually thinner. That said, I also find it harder to find in a way that feels annoying. I don't think I'll know whether that's just the changing cost of my eyes not being used to this style or something I'll still experience after using it for a few days.

Did something change about the unread markers? I feel like they feel unusably stacked on top of half of the colored stream border in a way that I don't feel like I remember.

@Evy have you measured the heights / widths for these cases using the browser inspector? It displays dimensions when you hover over an element in the inspector's Elements tab, so one should be able to know with certainty whether there's a change or not.

each of these have height 28px image.png

this has height 55px image.png
Great; if that's true before/after and the numbers batch for when you have recipient/sender headers too, we're probably good.

So I currently have height 33px for the individual one (and 68px for the two messages).

It's tricky because I added padding as per the design, for space between message and also space between focus rectangle and outer box. Where should that space come from? Do we want to decrease line-height for the messages?
Changing line-height seems like it'll affect line spacing within a paragraph in a way that's going to be bad?

Yeah that makes sense. I think that having space on both sides of the blue rectangle might just mean that messages will be spaced a bit further apart. I don't think that's necessarily a bad thing though.
I don't have this CSS in my head but I would try reducing the 5px/6px padding we have on messagebox-content if we'd adding padding around its container messagebox.

  • the old design is just 35, 51, and 51 is also the whole message.

So 7px needs to be removed.

I've been discussing with @Aman (amanagr) how to get the whole message to stay 51px high https://github.com/zulip/zulip/pull/23531#discussion_r1072666150

We're thinking it might make more sense to just make the message a little bit taller to account for the rectangle, since the only thing left I can pull padding from is the p element, which we probably don't want to do (because it's nice to have consistent padding for paragraphs in rendered markdown).

Keeping the p elements as they are, we would have heights of 31px (without profile info) and 54px (with profile info) -- which is 3px more than the heights on CZO.
